Exiled Venezuelan opposition rallies in support of Nobel winner Machado: 'The regime's days are numbered, and we are ready to return'
subhed: In Madrid and in dozens of cities around the world, opposition figures demonstrated unity as the Nobel Prize is set to be awarded to their leader on December 10 in Oslo, convinced that the collapse of Nicolás Maduro's regime is imminent.

title: Cambodia retaliates against Thailand after air strikes kill civilians and trigger mass evacuations
subhed: The renewed hostilities, after months of sporadic skirmishes and a stalled ceasefire deal, have escalated a century-old territorial dispute and deepened fears of a wider conflict in the region.

title: France's far-right Rassemblement National wants to reopen brothels
byline: By Denis Cosnard and Clément Guillou
subhed: MP Jean-Philippe Tanguy, who is preparing a bill to create cooperatives managed by sex workers themselves, says penalizing customers has worsened the situation of sex workers.

title: Russia refuses to yield after 11 years of failed peace negotiations on Ukraine
byline: By Marie Jégo and Faustine Vincent
subhed: Since the war began in 2014, every attempt at negotiation to end the conflict has failed, with Moscow violating every agreement. Today, with Europe sidelined and the Americans aligning with Russia's views, Vladimir Putin is convinced he holds the upper hand.

The incomplete transformation of Syria's Ahmad al-Sharaa, Islamist rebel turned president
subhed: 'Syria after al-Assad' (1/5). The man who toppled Syria's Baathist regime has succeeded in breaking the country's international isolation. Yet the former jihadist, who governs with a handful of loyal followers, has struggled to defuse the sectarian and ethnic tensions left by the civil war.

title: For this pilot's widow, Sarkozy's Libyan funding case is personal
subhed: The 1989 bombing of UTA Flight 772, ordered by the Libyan regime of Muammar Gaddafi, robbed Maryvone Raveneau of her husband. As a plaintiff in the trial of Nicolas Sarkozy, who is accused of having struck a deal with Gaddafi, she has been disappointed by the media battle waged by the former French president and his supporters.

title: 'The Voice of Hind Rajab' is more than a film about a child killed in Gaza
subhed: Kaouther Ben Hania's unprecedented work is less a film about Gaza and Hind Rajab, who was killed by Israeli tanks, than it is about our individual and collective powerlessness to stop the horror of mass killings, writes columnist Jean-Pierre Filiu.
